alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 7:30PM EDT until September 17 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard, Indian River and Okeechobee. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sebastian, Fellsmere, Indian River Shores, Blue Cypress Lake, Fort Drum, Sebastian Highlands, Wabasso, Winter Beach, Roseland, Gifford, Sebastian Inlet, Vero Lake Estates, Micco, Sebastian Inlet State Park, Orchid, North Beach, Wabasso Beach and Disneys Vero Beach Resort. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
